# Head to the `biomejs/biome` repository, and modify the source code in there.

title: useArrayLiterals
description: |
  Disallow Array constructors.
---
import { Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

<Tabs>
<TabItem label="JavaScript (and super languages)" icon="seti:javascript">
**Since**: `v1.7.2`
:::note
- Diagnostic Category: [`lint/correctness/useArrayLiterals`](/reference/diagnostics#diagnostic-category)
- This rule has an **unsafe** fix.
:::

Sources: 
- Same as: <a href="https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/no-array-constructor" target="_blank"><code>no-array-constructor</code></a>
- Same as: <a href="https://typescript-eslint.io/rules/no-array-constructor" target="_blank"><code>@typescript-eslint/no-array-constructor</code></a>

Disallow Array constructors.

Use of the Array constructor to construct a new array is generally discouraged in favor of array literal notation because of the single-argument pitfall and because the Array global may be redefined.
The exception is when the Array constructor intentionally creates sparse arrays of a specified size by giving the constructor a single numeric argument.

## Examples

### Invalid

```js
const xs = Array();
```

```js
const xs = Array(0, 1, 2);
```


```js
const xs = Array(...args);
```

### Valid

```js
const xs = Array(65000);
```

```js
const xs = [0, 1, 2];
```
